title: The Wrecker
author: Osbourne, Lloyd
snippet: Thiswelcome news broke upon them like the sun at midnight; and Hadden burstinto a storm of tears, sobbing aloud as he heaved upon the tackle.

title: The Wrecker
author: Osbourne, Lloyd
snippet: Carthew did hisbest, partly for the love of doing it, partly for love of the captain;Amalu was a willing drudge, and even Hemstead and Hadden turned to uponoccasion with a will.

title: The Wrecker
author: Osbourne, Lloyd
snippet: "But look here!" cried Hadden, "how do you mean to manage?

title: The Wrecker
author: Osbourne, Lloyd
snippet: He began to think less seriouslyof the scheme, Hadden appearing too irresponsible a guide; but on theother hand, he enjoyed himself amazingly.

title: The Wrecker
author: Osbourne, Lloyd
snippet: "Take your gin and guns to Putney!" cried Hadden.

title: The Wrecker
author: Osbourne, Lloyd
snippet: On descending from the hansom at the Currency Lass, Hadden was struckwith the appearance of the cabman, a gross, salt-looking man, red-faced,blue-eyed, short-handed and short-winded, perhaps nearing forty.

title: The Wrecker
author: Osbourne, Lloyd
snippet: "Are you?" cried Hadden.

title: The Wrecker
author: Osbourne, Lloyd
snippet: "And whatever else comes of it, you see," cried Hadden, "we get our keepfor nothing.

title: The Wrecker
author: Osbourne, Lloyd
snippet: "I'll show you! I'll figure it out for you!" cried Hadden, and with apencil on the back of the bill of fare proceeded to perform miracles.

title: The wrecker
author: Stevenson, Robert Louis
snippet: "And whatever else comes of it, you see," cried Hadden, "we get our keep for nothing.—Come, buy some togs, that's the first thing you have to do of course; and then we'll take a hansom and go to the Currency Lass."

title: The wrecker
author: Stevenson, Robert Louis
